name: Nike Art Gallery
description: A major art gallery featuring works by Nigerian artists, workshops and cultural events.

name: National Museum Lagos
description: National Museum housing archaeological and ethnographic collections.

name: Freedom Park
description: A heritage site and cultural center established on the site of an old colonial prison.

name: Kalakuta Republic Museum
description: Museum dedicated to the life and work of Fela Kuti with memorabilia and exhibits.

name: Lekki Conservation Centre
description: Urban nature conservation center with canopy walk and wildlife viewing.

name: National Arts Theatre
description: Iconic circular structure hosting performances and cultural ceremonies.

name: Tafawa Balewa Square
description: Large public square with monuments and event spaces commemorating national events.

name: Iga Idunganran Palace
description: The official palace of the Oba of Lagos with long historical significance.

name: Eko Atlantic (Coastal Walk)
description: A newly developed coastal city with modern waterfront promenades and attractions.

name: Badagry Slave Museum
description: Historical site documenting the transatlantic slave trade and local history.

name: Jhalobia Gardens
description: Community gardens and cultural event space with seasonal exhibitions.

name: National Stadium Lagos
description: Large stadium for sports and national events with historical significance.

name: Marina Promenade
description: Historic waterfront area with markets, music, and street life.

name: Terra Kulture
description: Cultural center with theatre, gallery spaces and language classes.

name: Local Market Trail
description: Vibrant local markets showcasing crafts, food and traditional commerce.
